overview: The Tipping Point is an experimental dance film exploring the cycles of pointless productivity, our reliance on resources and the need to self-realise. These themes are explored through a movement algorithm that depicts a miniature dystopian society. This society consists of four parties each with a single function - the director, their left-hand man, the guard and the hustler. This all changes when an unplanned event creates a ripple in the structure and pushes its inhabitants to question their role within the society and its functionality.
title: The Tipping Point
